Detailed Description

struct vpsissCalErrorCfg

Field Documentation

vpsissErrorCallBack vpsissCalErrorCfg::appCb

A function pointer, that would be called on error conditions with following arguments const UInt32 *event : Will point to array that hold actual error of type vpsissCalErrorSource_t and will have minimum 'numEvents' entries UInt32 numEvents : A positive value that indicate number of errors detected Ptr arg : A pointer provided by application while enabling the interrupt 'pAppCbArgs'

Attention
The appCb could be NULL. In which case the frame status would be updated. When appCb is not NULL, the provided function would be called and frame status would be updated.
uint32_t vpsissCalErrorCfg::cmplxIoId

Complex IO index, must be less than VPS_ISS_CAL_MAX_CMPLXIO_INST

vpsissCalErrorSource_t vpsissCalErrorCfg::errSrc[VPS_ISS_CAL_MAX_ERROR_INTERRUPTS]

Identify the error that have to be enabled

uint32_t vpsissCalErrorCfg::numErrorsToMonitor

Specify the number of errors that driver should monitor/enable

Ptr vpsissCalErrorCfg::pAdditionalArgs

Not used for now - should be set to NULL

Ptr vpsissCalErrorCfg::pAppCbArgs

Argument that would be passed when appCb is called.
